chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Owen G. Cloud Jr. was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Owen G. Cloud Jr. was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges & treatment release.  Defendant has 113 days credit if probation revoked.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia w/the exception of Ho-Chunk for employment purposes only.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.  Not operate m/v w/o valid DL.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Owen G. Cloud in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Parties rec/rev PSI.  No corrections to be made.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Masana makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of voting rights, felony firearm warnings and voting rights.

14CF199
Ct 1:

$1474.00 fine/costs/surcharges and $25.00 blood draw fees to be paid during term of probation per agent (cash bond to be applied)
Revoke DL 36 months
IID for 36 months effective upon licensure
AODA
Conditions of probation:
10 months jail w/huber privileges and release for treatment to commence forthwith

DNA sample to be provided
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances

Treatment/counseling per agent
Not to operate MV w/o valid DL
